name: Soccer Mix No. 2 Quiz | Soccer | 25 Questions

questions.text: Which country has been a member of FIFA since 1948 - but has never entered a World Cup competition?
questions.explanation:
Afghanistan.

	Angola have entered 5 times, Australia 10 and Algeria 10.

questions.text: Who scored the first ever golden goal in a World Cup fixture?
questions.explanation:
Blanc (Laurent).

	Blanc scored it for France against Paraguay in the second round of the 1998 finals. Batistuta also holds a record: he was the first player to score a hat-trick in TWO seperate World Cups, 1994 and 1998.

questions.text: Andy Goram has represented Scotland at football, and which other sport?
questions.explanation:
Cricket.

	Andy Goram was actually born in Bury in England, but because his father was Scottish, he was allowed to represent Scotland at both sports. He kept wicket for Scotland against Australia in 1989 and won three caps in total, but was told to stick to football by Australian bowler Merv Hughes.

questions.explanation:
Darren Huckerby broke his ankle while running out of the tunnel at the beginning of a match and tripping over his boot laces.

	Probably the most tragic of mishaps was when Indonesian star Mistar who, at the age of 25, was tragically killed by a herd of pigs that invaded his team's training pitch before a Cup fixture in 1995.

questions.text: Which of these international players suffers from the eye disease, glaucoma?
questions.explanation:
Edgar Davids.

	Davids has needed operations on both eyes due to acute glaucoma and, with approval, wore protective glasses during matches.

questions.text: Which country conceded 13 goals in a World Cup qualifier in 1981?
questions.explanation:
Fiji.

	New Zealand beat Fiji 13-0.

questions.text: Fiat are the biggest shareholder at Juventus - but who is the second?
questions.explanation:
Gaddafi (Colonel).

	In January 2002, Colonel Gaddafi acquired 5.31 percent of the club's shares, making him the second biggest shareholder.

questions.text: Which manager won the Champions League with Bayern Munich in 2001?
questions.explanation:
Hitzfeld (Ottmar).

	Bayern Munich beat Valencia on penalties.

questions.text: Who won the UEFA Cup in 1981?
questions.explanation:
Ipswich Town.

	Ipswich beat AZ Alkmaar of Holland in the final.

questions.text: What is the christian name of the French defender, Angloma?
questions.explanation: Jocelyn.

questions.text: Which former Barcelona player became the manager of Ajax in 2002?
questions.explanation:
Koeman (Ronald).

	Dutchman, Ronald Koeman scored the winning goal for Barcelona in the European Cup Final in 1992.

questions.text: Paul Gascoigne taught his teammates to swear in English and in a Geordie accent. What club beginning with ' L ' was he with?
questions.explanation:
Lazio.

	One of Gazza's most famous capers was on the field. He yellow-carded the referee after the official had dropped his card during a Rangers v Hibs game. He was booked for his troubles.

questions.text: What was the nickname of Kevin Keegan in his playing days?
questions.explanation: Mighty Mouse.

questions.text: Jaap Stam tested positive to which substance in 2001?
questions.explanation: Nandrolone.

questions.text: Which club did Christian Karembeu join, after leaving Middlesbrough in 2001?
questions.explanation:
Olympiakos.

	Karembeu was born in New Caledonia and represents France at international level.

questions.text: Which was Britain's first ever, all seater stadium?
questions.explanation:
Pittodrie.

	England's first all seater stadium was Coventry City's home ground at Highfield Road.

questions.text: Beginning with ' Q ', what is Scotland's oldest club?
questions.explanation:
Queens Park & Queen's Park.

	Queens Park were formed in 1867.

questions.text: What word precedes Vallecano to make the name of a Spanish club?
questions.explanation:
Rayo.

	Rayo Vallecano are based in Madrid.

questions.text: Who, from the following, is the only one NOT to play international football for England?
questions.explanation:
Steve Bruce.

	Bowles was capped 5 times, Ripley twice and Bastard once (1880). Bruce never played for England.

questions.text: Vinny Jones holds the record for the quickest yellow card in British football. How many seconds did it take him to achieve this?
questions.explanation: Three.

questions.text: Beginning with ' U ', what is the surname of the player who signed for Aston Villa from West Ham United, but then moved to Everton a month later on the advice of his wife?
questions.explanation:
Unsworth.

	Unsworth didn't kick a ball for Aston Villa.

questions.text: Argentinian Martin Palermo, broke his leg in November 2001 after celebrating a goal. What club was he playing for at the time?
questions.explanation:
Villarreal.

	Palermo celebrated a goal by hanging on a fence in front of Villarreal supporters - but the fence gave way under the pressure of the crowd and fell on his left leg, breaking two bones.

questions.text: Which Premiership import (FA Premier League) scored a wonder goal on his debut for Derby County against Manchester United in 1997?
questions.explanation:
Wanchope (Paulo).

	Paulo Wanchope comes from Costa Rica.

questions.text: What is the christian name of the French player, Djorkaeff?
questions.explanation:
Youri.

	Djorkaeff has played for Strasbourg, Monaco, Paris St Germain, Inter Milan and Kaiserslautern.

questions.text: Which player joined Juventus from Bari in 1999?
questions.explanation:
Zambrotta (Gianluca).

	Zola and Zenden have never played for Juventus. Zidane moved to Juventus from Bordeaux in 1996.
